title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
description: A startling and haunting vision of the world, 1984 is so powerful that it is completely convincing from start to finish.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A story of love and marriage among the English gentry during the Georgian era.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel of the Jazz Age that offers a portrait of the American dream's failure.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, led by Captain Ahab who is intent on finding the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: The Catcher in the Rye

title: Brave New World

description: A vision of a future society based on technological and scientific advances that also questions human freedom.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic tale of friendship and the battle between good and evil in Middle-earth.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A story of love, justice, and redemption set against the backdrop of post-revolutionary France.

title: Jane Eyre

description: An orphaned governess deals with her mysterious employer and the dark secrets of his estate.

title: The Alchemist

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
